content.description:
Start atop a block leaning against the north face and climb a nice hand crack up and right to join the obvious wide crack of

Hot Buttered Elves.

Medium sized gear works for the belay and descend off left.

Due to it's location the climb is inobvious at first on the approach.
This route climbs a face and a hairline crack.
content.protection: Bolts and fixed pitons in the hairline crack.  Bolted anchor on top.
content.location: Located just left of Back Door Santa.

content.description:
This climbs the striking wide crack visible from the Atlantis area direct from the toe of the formation. Thin slab moves are encountered getting into the crack which opens to a gaping 6-7" crack. At least one large piece would be helpful on this route.

The belay requires more normal size gear in the 2-3" range. Easy descent off left.

climbs.name: Grab My Sac For A Toy
climbs.fa: Tucker Tech, Tom Burke, Todd Gordon & Andrea Tomaszewski

content.description:
Worth doing if just for the name alone, this climbs an obvious crack midway between Hot Buttered Elves and Backdoor Santa. Another moderate to do when Atlantis is too cold or crowded.

There's no fixed anchor at the top, so belay at the cracks just below the summit cap. Then scramble to the north (climber's left) into a notch, under some boulders (past/under the topout for Hot Buttered Elves) and down a sort of dirty boulder-filled ramp to a short downclimb leading to the notch off the north face of the rock. From there, it's an easy descent back to the base.

climbs.name: Backdoor Santa
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Jason Cushner & Chris Miller, December 1994

content.description:
Climb a short crack to a bolted face on a buttress about 100' right of

Hot Buttered Elves

(the prominent offwidth). A well-protected and fun moderate that deserves to see some traffic.
